intro: Scutellaria kiusiana f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered skullcap, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are predominantly white, with some pink or purple hues, and are clustered in whorls along the stem. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
